title: Simplest Barbecue Spice Rub
description: My go to barbecue rub for pulled pork and brisket.
imageAlt: A jar of BBQ rub with different spices.
imageTitle: A jar of BBQ rub with different spices.
ingredients: 1/3 cup of coarse ground black pepper
steps: Combine all ingredients together in your dish of choice. I like to use a mason jar.
Stir until well combined. I'll typically shake the jar to mix it up.
Apply liberally!

title: Instant Pot Pot Roast
description: Such a delicious and simple and fast way of making pot roast
imageAlt: A delicious looking pot roast and vegetables

sectionIngredients: 1/2 tsp smoked paprika (regular paprika is fine too)
1 Chuck roast. Each pound feeds about 2 people. I usually get a 3 pound roast.
1 pound of full size carrots. Cut in about thirds
2-3 pounds of mini potatoes. If you have larger potatoes, just cut them up
6 stalks of full-size celery, ends cut off, cut in half

steps: Combine all of the seasoning mix ingredients together in a dish and set aside.
Set your Instant Pot on Saute.
Season the roast liberally on all sides with salt and pepper.
Coat the bottom of the instant pot with a high smoke point oil (canola, vegetable, peanut, etc...) and sear the roast on all sides.
Remove the roast and set it aside.
Take a little bit of the beef broth and deglaze the bottom of the pot. Probably about a cup or half a cup.
Add the roast back to the pot, along with your assortment of vegetables.
Take a part of your seasoning mix and sprinkle it over the roast and vegetables.
Add the rest of your beef broth into the pot along with two bay leaves.
Add in the rest of your seasoning mix into the pot.
Close and seal your Instant Pot and set it to manual for 95 minutes.
If you have time, let it naturally release. It will probably take about 45 minutes. If not, you can force the release.
Enjoy! It also makes great leftovers heated up in the microwave.

ingredients: 2 tsp dark chili powder (regular is fine)
steps: Combine all ingredients together in your dish of choice. I like to use a mason jar.
Stir until well combined. I'll typically shake the jar to mix it up.
Apply liberally in taco soup, enchiladas, tacos, etc...

title: Shrimp Tacos
description: Shrimp tacos with a spicy rub topped with a tangy salsa
imageAlt: Shrimp and mango salsa in a tortilla surrounded by spices, limes, garlic, and oil
steps: Start to prepare the mango salsa. Grab a dish, dice your mangoes and set in the dish
Dice the red onion and add to the dish
Chop the cilantro and add to the dish
Slice the lime, squeeze in, and mix the salsa
Crack in some sea salt and mix again
Optionally chop your habenero and add to the salsa and mix
Set your salsa to the side, and add some oil to a pan on medium heat
Add your shrimp to the pan, and season with your favorite taco seasoning
Sear off your shrimp and cook to done
Remove your shrimp from the pan, set to the side, and add some more oil and some more taco seasoning to the pan
Add your tortillas to the pan and toast them on both sides
Remove your tortillas from the pan, and assemble your tacos
Enjoy!

sectionIngredients: 1 juicy lime (or 2 if there's not very much juice
OPTIONAL - 1 fresh habenero pepper for heat
1 lb extra small peeled, deveined shrimp (or whatever size you want, if its large, chop them up a little bit)

title: Fondant Potatoes
description: Seared potatoes cooked off with aromatics and chicken broth
imageAlt: A bunch of seared potatoes in broth surrounded by aromatics in a cast iron pan
ingredients: 8 russet potatoes or larger yellow potatoes
High smoke point oil (canola, vegetable, peanut)
2 cups of chicken or vegetable broth
1 head of garlic, top chopped off
A few sprigs of fresh rosemary
A few sprigs of Fresh thyme
A few sprigs of Fresh Sage
steps: Start by peeling the potatoes. Then, trim both ends to create a stable, flat base, allowing the potato to stand upright. Finally, slice each potato in half crosswise.
Coat in a high smoke point oil and copious amounts of sea salt and black pepper
Put a little more oil on your cooking surface and sear both flat sides of the potato. Sometimes I'll sear the sides too.
Add into your pan (use a pan that can withstand a high heat, like stainless steel or cast iron)
Pour in your chicken broth, and add your aromatics around the pan
Cook for about 45 minutes, or until your potatoes are fork tender
Serve hot! Mash with a fork and pour some of the fond on top for a delicious bite!

title: Award-Winning Chili
description: A deep, rich, spicy chili with a variety of meats, veggies, spices, and beans
imageAlt: A pot of deep red and dark chili with vegetables and beans and surrounded by spices

sectionIngredients: 1 tsp mexican oregano (can sub other oregano)
3 fresh chopped jalapenos (sub one large green bell pepper for less spice)
1 large yellow or white onion, diced
4 oz hatch green chilis (heat is your preference)
3 cans of Medium Bush's Best Chili Magic Chili Starter, Campfire Style

steps: In a small dish, mix together all of the seasoning mix ingredients and set aside.
In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain the fat, but keep the meat in the pot.
In the same pot, brown the sausage over medium heat. Don't drain the fat and keep the meat in the pot
Chop up all the vegetables, and add them to the pot. Cook until veggies are a little softened. Maybe 5 minutes.
Add the diced tomatoes and hatch green chilis to the pot. Stir to combine.
Add the tomato sauce to the pot. Stir to combine.
Add in the seasoning mix you prepared before. Stir to combine.
Add in the tomato paste to the pot. Stir to combine.
Let simmer on your stove for about an hour.
Add in the three cans of beans and stir to combine.
Let simmer another 45 minutes to an hour.
Enjoy with your favorite toppings, such as cheddar cheese, sour cream, or maybe fritos corn chips!
